trans-unit.source: When submitting an IAP, the options on the Properties page help determine the behavior of your IAP when offered to customers.
trans-unit.target: When submitting an IAP, the options on the Properties page help determine the behavior of your IAP when offered to customers.

trans-unit.source: Enter IAP properties
trans-unit.target: Enter IAP properties

trans-unit.source: Enter IAP properties
trans-unit.target: Enter IAP properties

trans-unit.source: When submitting an IAP, the options on the **Properties** page help determine the behavior of your IAP when offered to customers.
trans-unit.target: When submitting an IAP, the options on the **Properties** page help determine the behavior of your IAP when offered to customers.

trans-unit.source: Product type
trans-unit.target: Product type

trans-unit.source: First, you'll need to indicate which type of IAP you are offering.
trans-unit.target: First, you'll need to indicate which type of IAP you are offering.

trans-unit.source: This selection refers to how the customer can use your IAP.
trans-unit.target: This selection refers to how the customer can use your IAP.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You won't be able to change the product type for this IAP after it's been published.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You won't be able to change the product type for this IAP after it's been published.

trans-unit.source: **Consumable:** A product that can be purchased, used (consumed), and then purchased again.
trans-unit.target: **Consumable:** A product that can be purchased, used (consumed), and then purchased again.

trans-unit.source: Consumable IAPs are often used for things like in-game currency (gold, coins, etc.) which can be purchased in set amounts and then used up by the customer.
trans-unit.target: Consumable IAPs are often used for things like in-game currency (gold, coins, etc.) which can be purchased in set amounts and then used up by the customer.

trans-unit.source: **Durable:** A product that’s bought and owned by the buyer for a specified period of time.
trans-unit.target: **Durable:** A product that’s bought and owned by the buyer for a specified period of time.

trans-unit.source: Durable IAPs are often used to unlock additional functionality in an app.
trans-unit.target: Durable IAPs are often used to unlock additional functionality in an app.

trans-unit.source: Durable IAPs are not consumed, but you can set the **Product lifetime** so that they expire after a set duration (with options from 1-365 days).
trans-unit.target: Durable IAPs are not consumed, but you can set the **Product lifetime** so that they expire after a set duration (with options from 1-365 days).

trans-unit.source: The default **Product lifetime** for a durable IAP is **Forever**, which means the IAP never expires.
trans-unit.target: The default **Product lifetime** for a durable IAP is **Forever**, which means the IAP never expires.

trans-unit.source: Content type
trans-unit.target: Content type

trans-unit.source: Regardless of your IAP's product type, you'll also need to indicate the type of content you're offering.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of your IAP's product type, you'll also need to indicate the type of content you're offering.

trans-unit.source: By default, this is set to **Electronic software download**.
trans-unit.target: By default, this is set to **Electronic software download**.

trans-unit.source: If another option from the list seems to describe your IAP better (for example, if you are offering a music download or an e-book), choose that instead.
trans-unit.target: If another option from the list seems to describe your IAP better (for example, if you are offering a music download or an e-book), choose that instead.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can leave this set to **Electronic software download**, which is appropriate for most IAPs.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you can leave this set to **Electronic software download**, which is appropriate for most IAPs.

trans-unit.source: Electronic software download
trans-unit.target: Electronic software download

trans-unit.source: Electronic books
trans-unit.target: Electronic books

trans-unit.source: Electronic magazine single issue
trans-unit.target: Electronic magazine single issue

trans-unit.source: Electronic newspaper single issue
trans-unit.target: Electronic newspaper single issue

trans-unit.source: Music download
trans-unit.target: Music download

trans-unit.source: Music streaming
trans-unit.target: Music streaming

trans-unit.source: Online data storage/services
trans-unit.target: Online data storage/services

trans-unit.source: Video download
trans-unit.target: Video download

trans-unit.source: Video streaming
trans-unit.target: Video streaming

trans-unit.source: Software as a service
trans-unit.target: Software as a service

trans-unit.source: Keywords
trans-unit.target: Keywords

trans-unit.source: You have the option to provide up to ten keywords of up to 30 characters each for each IAP you submit.
trans-unit.target: You have the option to provide up to ten keywords of up to 30 characters each for each IAP you submit.

trans-unit.source: Your app can then query for products that match these words.
trans-unit.target: Your app can then query for products that match these words.

trans-unit.source: This feature lets you build screens in your app that can load IAPs without you having to directly specify the product ID in your app's code.
trans-unit.target: This feature lets you build screens in your app that can load IAPs without you having to directly specify the product ID in your app's code.

trans-unit.source: You can then change the IAP's keywords anytime, without having to make code changes in your app or submit the app again.
trans-unit.target: You can then change the IAP's keywords anytime, without having to make code changes in your app or submit the app again.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Keywords are not available for use in packages targeting Windows 8 and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Keywords are not available for use in packages targeting Windows 8 and Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Tag
trans-unit.target: Tag

trans-unit.source: You also have the option to enter up to 3000 characters into the **Tag** field.
trans-unit.target: You also have the option to enter up to 3000 characters into the **Tag** field.

trans-unit.source: This is a way to provide extra context for your in-app product.
trans-unit.target: This is a way to provide extra context for your in-app product.

trans-unit.source: Let’s say you have a game, and you’re selling a bag of gold coins as an IAP.
trans-unit.target: Let’s say you have a game, and you’re selling a bag of gold coins as an IAP.

trans-unit.source: Using the Tags field, the app can query for this bag of gold.
trans-unit.target: Using the Tags field, the app can query for this bag of gold.

trans-unit.source: You can adjust the value at any time (in this case, the number of coins in your bag) by updating the info in the IAP's **Tag** field, without having to make code changes in your app or submit the app again.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust the value at any time (in this case, the number of coins in your bag) by updating the info in the IAP's **Tag** field, without having to make code changes in your app or submit the app again.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The **Tag** field is not available for use in packages targeting Windows 8 and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The **Tag** field is not available for use in packages targeting Windows 8 and Windows 8.1.
